question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Authorization Bypass] Can an attacker exploit the Contains() check if ProposerWhiteList allows duplicate addresses after list manipulation, enabling unauthorized proposal creation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Null Reference] If State.Organizations[organizationAddress] returns null but the assertion at line 14 passes due to race condition, can line 15 throw NullReferenceException allowing DOS? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Logic Error] Does the function verify that organizationAddress itself is valid before checking State.Organizations, allowing proposals for non-existent organizations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Access Control] Can an attacker bypass authorization if ProposerWhiteList is empty but the Contains() check still passes for zero-address scenarios? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [State Manipulation] If organization data can be modified between line 13 and line 15, can an attacker exploit TOCTOU vulnerability to bypass whitelist verification? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Gas Attack] Can an attacker create organizations with extremely large ProposerWhiteList arrays causing Contains() iteration at line 15 to exceed gas limits and DOS proposal creation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Input Validation] Does the function validate that the proposer address is not null or zero-address before performing Contains() check? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Enumeration Attack] Can an attacker enumerate valid proposer addresses by repeatedly calling functions using this check and observing different error messages? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedOrganizationMember()] [Authorization Bypass] Can an attacker exploit Contains() on OrganizationMemberList if the list allows duplicate members, enabling double-counting in vote calculations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedOrganizationMember()] [Null Reference] If organization parameter is null, does line 20 throw unhandled exception before the assertion message is shown? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedOrganizationMember()] [Gas Attack] Can an attacker create organizations with extremely large OrganizationMemberList causing Contains() at line 20 to exceed gas limits during voting operations? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedOrganizationMember()] [Logic Error] Does the function validate that the member address is not null or zero-address before checking membership? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedOrganizationMember()] [State Consistency] If OrganizationMemberList can be modified between multiple calls in a transaction, can TOCTOU vulnerabilities allow unauthorized voting? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsReleaseThresholdReached()] [Logic Error] If IsProposalRejected returns true at line 26, the function returns false at line 28, but does this correctly handle the case where proposal has enough approvals but is rejected? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsReleaseThresholdReached()] [Threshold Bypass] Can an attacker manipulate voting to make IsProposalAbstained return true at line 30, bypassing the approval threshold check even when MinimalApprovalThreshold is met? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsReleaseThresholdReached()] [Short Circuit] Does the short-circuit evaluation at line 31 (!isAbstained && CheckEnoughVoteAndApprovals) allow proposals to pass without proper vote counting if isAbstained is false? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsReleaseThresholdReached()] [Order Dependency] Does the order of checks (rejection before abstention before approval) create edge cases where valid proposals are incorrectly rejected? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsReleaseThresholdReached()] [State Race] Can multiple simultaneous calls to this function with the same proposal produce different results due to non-atomic state reads? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsProposalRejected()] [Integer Boundary] At line 38, if MaximalRejectionThreshold is set to int.MaxValue, can rejectionMemberCount exceed it through overflow, incorrectly returning false? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsProposalRejected()] [Counting Error] Does the Count() with Contains() at lines 36-37 correctly handle duplicate addresses in proposal.Rejections if they exist? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsProposalRejected()] [Threshold Logic] Is using '>' operator at line 38 correct, or should it be '>=' to match the threshold semantic meaning? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsProposalRejected()] [Gas Attack] Can an attacker add many rejection votes (even from non-members) to proposal.Rejections, causing the Count().Contains() nested iteration to exceed gas limits? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsProposalRejected()] [Validation Gap] Does the function verify that organization.OrganizationMemberList is not null or empty before using Contains(), risking NullReferenceException? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsProposalRejected()] [Double Count] If proposal.Rejections contains addresses that appear multiple times in OrganizationMemberList (despite validation), can votes be double-counted? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: IsProposalAbstained()] [Integer Boundary] At line 44, if MaximalAbstentionThreshold is int.MaxValue, can abstentionMemberCount overflow, causing incorrect comparison result? (High)
